Formal invitations will definitely add to the luxury and sophistication of the celebration.

**Dress Code:**

Including a dress code on the invitation is an excellent idea to ensure your guests dress appropriately for the vintage glamour theme. This will help create a cohesive and immersive atmosphere, making the celebration even more special.

**Tips for Including a Dress Code:**

* Be specific: Instead of just saying "formal attire," specify the dress code as "Vintage Glamour" or "Black Tie Optional" to give guests a clear idea of what to expect.
* Provide guidance: You can add a sentence or two to describe the dress code, such as "Ladies, think Old Hollywood glamour with flowing gowns and statement accessories. Gentlemen, don dapper suits and ties."
* Keep it concise: Don't overwhelm guests with too much information. Keep the dress code description brief and to the point.
* Consider adding a hashtag: Encourage guests to share photos on social media using a branded hashtag, such as #VintageGlamourBirthday or #SILsSpecialNight.

Here's an example of how you could include a dress code on the invitation:

"Join us for an evening of vintage glamour as we celebrate [Sister-in-Law's Name]'s birthday!

Date: [Date]
Time: [Time]
Location: [Location]

Dress Code: Vintage Glamour (Ladies, think Old Hollywood glamour with flowing gowns and statement accessories. Gentlemen, don dapper suits and ties.)

Please RSVP by [RSVP Deadline] to let us know you're joining us for an unforgettable night of luxury and celebration.

We look forward to seeing you there!"

**Additional Tips:**

* Make sure to communicate the dress code clearly on your invitation design, so it's easy for guests to see and understand.
* Consider adding a dress code to your event's social media pages or website, if you have one, to reinforce the message.
* If you're concerned about guests not adhering to the dress code, you could also include a gentle reminder in a follow-up email or phone call before the event.

By including a dress code on the invitation, you'll set the tone for a sophisticated and glamorous celebration that your sister-in-law will cherish forever.
